section.title: Job Opportunities
section.para: Vacancy Reference No: PC00789 Salary: GBP 24,161-31,525

We are looking for a software developer to join a Wellcome Trust funded project applying innovative software engineering to the integration of biological data. FlyMine is a data warehouse of functional genomics data from the model organisms Drosophila melanogaster and Anopheles gambiae. The software created to enable FlyMine is generic and now being used to build other biological data warehouses.

FlyMine (www.flymine.org) is a freely available resource providing a powerful Web interface for researchers to perform complex queries over a wide range of biological data. In building FlyMine we have developed InterMine (www.intermine.org) - a data model independent, object-based data integration and query system with a sophisticated Struts/JSP Web application. A team of five software developers is responsible for designing, coding, testing and importing data into the system, many parts of which are technically challenging. We work with Java in a Unix/Linux environment and use the PostgreSQL database. All of our code is freely available under an open source licence.

You will be involved in all aspects of the system. You will have worked as a software developer for at least 2 years in a team environment. Experience with Java and relational databases would be a significant advantage. You should have experience or an interest in working with biological data.
Informal enquiries to Richard Smith: richard@flymine.org

Applications, to include a PD18 cover sheet, full CV and details of three referees, should be addressed to Mrs Tracy Oakley, Department of Genetics, Downing Street, Cambridge, CB2 3EH or e-mail: t.oakley@gen.cam.ac.uk.
* The funds for this post are available until 31 December 2007 in the first instance.
